column4: if i use apt-get dist-upgrade to upgrade to edgy ( i have breezy) and , i stop it , when i do it again , the packages downloaded, are not re-downloaded, and are instaled propelly , no ? (dist-upgrade will see if there are packages downloaded and in the correct moment , will install it , within the others downloaded , no ? )
so i don't have to use dpkg -i or so
actually the recommended path is breezy -> dapper -> edgy
anyway, dist-upgrade won't redownload packages, it resumes
